sentence: Representative Liz Cheney, Republican of Wyoming and the vice chairwoman of the committee, has suggested that Mr. Trump could have violated through action or inaction? a previously obscure obstruction charge that federal prosecutors have been using to pursue rioters at the Capitol on Jan. 6: the disruption of Congress's duty to certify the final stage of a presidential election.
title: The Jan. 6 Committee's Consideration of a Criminal Referral, Explained

sentence: And on the House side, Trump gave to Harriet Hageman, who is running a primary challenge to Rep. Liz Cheney, R-Wyo.
title: Trump gave $1M to Meadows nonprofit weeks after Jan. 6 panel's creation

sentence: The lawmakers, Representatives Liz Cheney of Wyoming and Adam Kinzinger of Illinois, were censured for participating in what the party's resolution described as the persecution of ordinary citizens engaged in legitimate political discourse.? In a rambling statement issued Friday evening, Mr. Trump refrained from sharply attacking Mr. Pence.
title: Trump Is Wrong,' Pence Says of False Claim About Overturning Election

sentence: A potential criminal prosecution, however, could represent a significant return for the two GOP members of the panel, Reps. Liz Cheney of Wyoming and Adam Kinzinger of Illinois, who have put their political careers on the line to oppose Trump.
author: Stephen Collinson
title: January 6 committee's aggressive approach on Trump may put Merrick Garland in a tight spot
